qas.question: What is the main winding on a squirrel cage motor capable of withstanding?

answers.text: a rotational motion on the rotor

qas.question: What sort of capacitors are used on the second winding of a squirrel cage motor?
What does the capacitor on the second winding of a squirrel cage motor do?

answers.text: introduce a lead in the sinusoidal current

qas.question: What does the centrifugal switch do the capacitor when the rotor achieves operating speed?
Where is the start capacitor commonly mounted?

answers.text: to the side of the motor housing

qas.question: What is the main winding on a squirrel cage motor capable of withstanding?
What sort of capacitors are never used on the second winding of a squirrel cage motor?
What doesn't the capacitor on the second winding of a squirrel cage motor do?
Where is the start capacitor commonly mounted?

context: In single phase squirrel cage motors, the primary winding within the motor housing is not capable of starting <a0_0>a <b5_0>rotational motion on the rotor<b5_0/><a0_0/>, but is capable of sustaining one. To start the motor, a secondary "start" winding has a <a1_0><b6_0>series non-polarized starting capacitor<b6_0/><a1_0/> to <a2_0>introduce a lead in the sinusoidal current<a2_0/>. When the secondary (start) winding is placed at an angle with respect to the primary (run) winding, a rotating electric field is created. The force of the rotational field is not constant, but is sufficient to start the rotor spinning. When the rotor comes close to operating speed, a centrifugal switch (or current-sensitive relay in series with the main winding) <a3_0>disconnects the capacitor<a3_0/>. The start capacitor is typically mounted <a4_0>to <b8_0>the side of the motor<b8_0/> housing<a4_0/>. These are called <b7_0>capacitor-start motors<b7_0/>, that have relatively high starting torque. Typically they can have up-to four times as much starting torque than a split-phase motor and are used on applications such as compressors, pressure washers and any small device requiring high starting torques.
